website_summaries.verdict: While it's a good supplement to your CPA test studying materials, it may not offer all the information needed to pass the exam.
pros: Easy to read and follow, making it the ideal addition to CPA studying guides and text books
Has over 4,000 practice questions and 164 simulations
Written by a former CPA with over 29 years in the industry
cons: The information is somewhat broad, and not as in-depth as many of the questions or topics that may be on the official CPA exam

customer_reviews.title: I thought it would be good to start with this before I actually take my ...
customer_reviews.text: I am preparing to start my CPA exam, and since I've been out of school for a while, I thought it would be good to start with this before I actually take my review course. I like how easily the chapters are to read and how I can jump between chapters. Also, I do like that the answer key has a small explanation as to why that is the correct answer. Overall I do like it a lot. Again, this will not be my only form of study, this is more of a warm up to get me use to focusing and studying again.
customer_reviews.author: Ney

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for making a study plan but be cautious that this is from 2014
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Asad

customer_reviews.title: well organized and good refresher
customer_reviews.text: Seems very well organized and good refresher for those who have been out of school a while.
customer_reviews.author: CATHERN ANN GARCIA

customer_reviews.title: Good Tips
customer_reviews.text: Information found in book is great. However, bought it too close to the change in exam structure , so some of the info is irrelevant to the new 2017 exam, and did not get a discount for it being so close to change.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great book! Very easy to read on kindle
customer_reviews.text: Great book! Very easy to read on kindle, I can use my spare time to study. Not like roger or Becker, it's very easy to understand as an international student. I use it as a supplement to roger. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: lalala

customer_reviews.title: Great reference book
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for my niece who is in the process of taking her CPA exam. It was really informative and helpful preparing her for the test.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good overview of broad concepts. Only use this as one of your supplemental study materials.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: So So
customer_reviews.text: It have some info but not enough to help you pass the exam.
customer_reviews.author: Frank J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Prep!
customer_reviews.text: Great prep to start studying for the CPA! You will need more in depth study material but this is a great place to start getting your thoughts in order and to learn about the general concepts of the exam.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Awesome book! Made me realize that I don't want ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome book! Made me realize that I don't want to be a CPA!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon

customer_reviews.title: Nice Introduction
customer_reviews.text: While this book provides a nice overview of the profession it does not provide adequate preparation for the exam. With the book, the reader gets one months access to the website. Practice makes perfect and most people will need more time to prepare thoroughly. It really is just a teaser for the online curriculum. The book does provide perspective and has plenty of tips for taking the exam. As with all editions of the Dummies series, this book is nicely organized and written in a user friendly manner. If you are looking for an introduction to the field, this is more than adequate. But for actual test prep, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Antigone Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Good overview
customer_reviews.text: Nice overview of the exam although not the definitive reference book to have on hand. Author Kenneth Boyd does make that clear though that the book is for those who are interested in taking the exam and then the topics that follow adhere to that goal. I am partial to the "For Dummies" line due to the way the line organizes information and this book is no exception as it is well organized in its ideas. Nicely done. Again, not a definitive reference but definitely a good overview.
customer_reviews.author: sanoe.net

customer_reviews.title: Insufficient information in the book itself
customer_reviews.text: Compared to other "for dummies" books, this is a rather disappointing volume. There just isn't the information we've come to expect from the series. The real information comes from the online presentation and not from the book. The one use I see here is that it may be useful in helping high school students decide whether they want to go into accounting and business careers and the subsequent education. Otherwise, potential exam takers will get a lot more from the online material than from the book.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Overview of the Basics - A Better Title Would Be "CPA Basics for Dummies"
customer_reviews.text: I am not a CPA, but I found the book to be nothing more than an overview of the basics of a CPA. I would not think this would actually be very helpful in preparing for the CPA Exam. The majority of this stuff you may already know from college accounting classes or if you have a small business and understand the basics of finance and bookkeeping. It is a good book as far as basic knowledge a CPA needs, but I think a more appropriate title would have been something like "CPA Basics for Dummies".
customer_reviews.author: RicoTX

customer_reviews.title: much better than the long-winded explanation in my textbooks
customer_reviews.text: I haven't decided whether I am going to be taking the CPA Exam yet. Currently, I am taking graduate courses in finance and financial accounting and thought that I needed a more dumbed-down version than the textbooks for those college courses. This "for Dummies" book explains Present Value, etc. much better than the long-winded explanation in my textbooks. This has been a lifesaver for my homework tonight; so it's worth it already!
customer_reviews.author: AIROLF

customer_reviews.title: Concise and practical
customer_reviews.text: This review material is very concise. It should also be used as supplemental review material. It's a time saver after you read expended CPA review materials.
customer_reviews.author: Papatia Feauxzar

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Loved this book! It's larger And covers quite a bit. Best thing is it's understandable that other cap books. It doesn't have everything, you'll need to go online. If you can't get it done with this, you're not going to.
customer_reviews.author: KO

product_meta.title: CPA Exam For Dummies with Online Practice
